title: The Hessian of tall-skinny networks is easy to invert
summary: arXiv:2601.06096v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We describe an exact algorithm for solving linear systems $Hx=b$ where $H$ is the Hessian of a deep net. title: Filtering Beats Fine Tuning: A Bayesian Kalman View of In Context Learning in LLMs

title: Good technology should change the world
summary: The billionaire investor Peter Thiel (or maybe his ghostwriter) once said, “We were promised flying cars, instead we got 140 characters.” That quip originally appeared in a manifesto for Thiel’s venture fund in 2011.

title: How next-generation nuclear reactors break out of the 20th-century blueprint
summary: Commercial nuclear reactors all work pretty much the same way. Atoms of a radioactive material split, emitting neutrons. Those bump into other atoms, splitting them and causing them to emit more neutrons, which bump into other atoms, continuing the chain reaction.
content: Commercial nuclear reactors all work pretty much the same way. Atoms of a radioactive material split, emitting neutrons. Those bump into other atoms, splitting them and causing them to emit more neutrons, which bump into other atoms, continuing the chain reaction.
